extracted-table.table-wrap-foot: MRi-Share, magnetic resonance imaging subcohort of Internet-based Students HeAlth Research Enterprise; BIL&GIN, Brain Imaging of Lateralization study at Groupe d'Imagerie Neurofonctionnelle; SYS cohort, Saguenay Youth Study; ASPSF, Austrian Stroke Prevention Study Family; OATS, Older Australian Twin Study; LBC 1936, Lothian Birth Cohort; MAS, Memory and Ageing Study; TIV, total intracranial volume estimated with Freesurfer 5.3 version except “*” with FreeSurfer 6.0 version. †data subsample size < 30 (not included in the age category statistical analysis).

extracted-table.table-caption: Basic statistics of axial diffusivity (AD, in mm2 s−1 × 10−4) average across a white matter skeleton for each age category and each contributing data set.
extracted-table.table-wrap-foot: Values are mean (S.D. and range [min, max] across the age category sample). See Table 1 legend for the meaning of data set abbreviated names.

caption.p: Basic statistics of axial diffusivity (AD, in mm2 s−1 × 10−4) average across a white matter skeleton for each age category and each contributing data set.

table-wrap-foot.p: Values are mean (S.D. and range [min, max] across the age category sample). See Table 1 legend for the meaning of data set abbreviated names.

extracted-table.table-wrap-foot: Values are mean (S.D. and range [min, max] across the age category sample (see Table 1 legend for the meaning of data set abbreviated names).

extracted-table.table-caption: Basic statistics of fractional anisotropy (FA, unitless) average across individual FA skeleton for each age range category and each contributing data set.
extracted-table.table-wrap-foot: Values are mean (S.D. and range [min, max] across the age category sample (see Table 1 legend for the meaning of data set abbreviated names).

table-wrap-foot.p: Values are mean (S.D. and range [min, max] across the age category sample (see Table 1 legend for the meaning of data set abbreviated names).

extracted-table.table-caption: ANOVA effect of age (estimate (standard error) and significance p-value) on five DTI metrics (AD, RD, MD, PSMD, and FA evaluated across individual FA skeletons).
extracted-table.table-wrap-foot: Values are in mm2 s−1 year-−1 × 10−6 for AD, RD, and MD, in mm2 s−1 year−1 × 10−7 for PSMD, and in year−1 × 10−3 for FA.

caption.p: ANOVA effect of age (estimate (standard error) and significance p-value) on five DTI metrics (AD, RD, MD, PSMD, and FA evaluated across individual FA skeletons).

table-wrap-foot.p: Values are in mm2 s−1 year-−1 × 10−6 for AD, RD, and MD, in mm2 s−1 year−1 × 10−7 for PSMD, and in year−1 × 10−3 for FA.

extracted-table.table-caption: ANOVA effect of sex and TIV (estimate (standard error) and significance p value) on five DTI metrics (AD, RD, MD, PSMD, and FA evaluated across individual FA skeletons).
extracted-table.table-wrap-foot: Values for the effects of sex are in mm2 s−1 × 10−6 for AD, RD, MD, and PSMD and in ×10−3 for FA, and for the effects of TIV are in mm2 s−1 cm−3 × 10−6 for AD, RD MD, and PSMD and in cm−3 × 10−5 for FA.

caption.p: ANOVA effect of sex and TIV (estimate (standard error) and significance p value) on five DTI metrics (AD, RD, MD, PSMD, and FA evaluated across individual FA skeletons).

table-wrap-foot.p: Values for the effects of sex are in mm2 s−1 × 10−6 for AD, RD, MD, and PSMD and in ×10−3 for FA, and for the effects of TIV are in mm2 s−1 cm−3 × 10−6 for AD, RD MD, and PSMD and in cm−3 × 10−5 for FA.
